message.content: {"id": "120922", "title": "Bug 120922: \"Dirty Page\" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement", "description": "Bug 120922: \"Dirty Page\" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be accessed until the changes are saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. A dialog titled \"Error\" appears. The options displayed are: \"Yes\" to save the changes, \"No\" to discard the changes, and \"Cancel\" to do nothing and remain on the Source page.", "OB": "When editing XML in the \"source\" view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating the need to save the changes. The user should be prompted with clear options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.", "EB": "Improve the error message to explicitly state that the changes need to be saved, discarded, or canceled. Instead of a dialog titled \"Error\", consider using a more descriptive title such as \"Unsaved Changes\" or \"Save Changes\".", "SR": "Update the behavior of the XML Report Designer editor so that when switching from the \"source\" view to the Layout view, users are presented with a clear prompt to save, discard, or cancel their changes."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '120922', 'title': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved', 'description': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved." (including the quotes). And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?<Yes <No <CancelYes would save the changesNo would discard the changesCancel would do nothing and remain on the Source pageIn addition, the dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes). ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes.This problem is the user has to figure out what he needs to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very good.The error message is "Source page is dirty. '}
